TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SelectionRangeConverter extends System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter

Docs.summary: Provides a type converter to convert objects to and from various other types.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange> class represents a single date or a range of dates. This class is commonly associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> control, where it represents the selected and highlighted dates. The SelectionRangeConverter class is an adjunct class to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange> that enables you to convert to and from other types, most often strings.
For more information about type converters, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class, [Generalized Type Conversion](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md), and [How to: Implement a Type Converter](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
> [!NOTE] > You should never create a SelectionRangeConverter. Instead, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> class. For more information, see the examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks SelectionRangeConverter is the default constructor supplied by the compiler.
You should never create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRangeConverter>. Instead, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> class. For more information, see the examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class.

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool CanConvertFrom (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, Type sourceType);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance bool CanConvertFrom(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, class System.Type sourceType) cil managed

Docs.param: A that provides a format context.
Docs.summary: Determines if this converter can convert an object of the specified source type to the native type of the converter by querying the supplied type descriptor context.
Docs.returns: if the converter can perform the specified conversion; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRangeConverter> class is specialized to convert between the types <xref:System.String> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange>. As a result, the CanConvertFrom method returns `true` if the `sourceType` parameter is of type <xref:System.String>. Otherwise, it defers the call to the base implementation of this method, <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.CanConvertFrom%28System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext%2CSystem.Type%29?displayProperty=fullName>.

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool CanConvertTo (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, Type destinationType);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance bool CanConvertTo(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, class System.Type destinationType) cil managed

Docs.param: A that provides a format context.
Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this converter can convert an object to the specified destination type by using the specified context.
Docs.returns: if this converter can perform the specified conversion; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The CanConvertTo method returns `true` if the `destinationType` parameter is of type <xref:System.String> or <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.InstanceDescriptor>. Otherwise, it defers the call to the base implementation of this method, <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.CanConvertTo%28System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext%2CSystem.Type%29?displayProperty=fullName>.

MemberSignature.Value: public override object ConvertFrom (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture, object value);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance object ConvertFrom(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, class System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture, object value) cil managed

Docs.param: A that provides a format context.
The locale information for the conversion.
Docs.summary: Converts the specified value to the converter's native type by using the specified locale.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ConvertFrom method is specialized to convert <xref:System.String> values that represent a range of dates to their <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange> representations. Types other than <xref:System.String> are passed to the base class implementation of this method.

Docs.exception: is of type <xref:System.String> but could not be parsed into two strings representing dates.
is of type <xref:System.String> that was parsed into two strings, but the conversion of one or both into the <xref:System.DateTime> type did not succeed.

MemberSignature.Value: public override object ConvertTo (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture, object value, Type destinationType);

.method public hidebysig virtual instance object ConvertTo(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, class System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture, object value, class System.Type destinationType) cil managed

Docs.param: A that provides a format context.
The locale information for the conversion.
Docs.summary: Converts the specified object to another type by using the specified culture.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ConvertTo method is specialized to convert <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange> values to their <xref:System.String> or <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.InstanceDescriptor> representations. Other types are passed to the base class implementation of this method.

MemberSignature.Value: public override object CreateInstance (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, System.Collections.IDictionary propertyValues);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance object CreateInstance(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, class System.Collections.IDictionary propertyValues) cil managed

Docs.param: A that provides a format context.
An <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> that contains the new property values.
Docs.summary: Creates a object by using the specified type descriptor and set of property values for that object.
Docs.returns: If successful, the newly created ; otherwise, this method throws an exception.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRangeConverter.CreateInstance%2A> method to make changes to an existing immutable object by creating a modified version of it. This method expects the `propertyValues` parameter to have elements with key values of `Start` and `End`, each with the corresponding <xref:System.DateTime> value.

Docs.exception: is or its `Start` and `End` elements could not be converted into a .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool GetCreateInstanceSupported(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: A that provides a format context.
Docs.summary: Determines if changing a value on an instance should require a call to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRangeConverter.CreateInstance%2A> to create a new value.
Docs.returns: if <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRangeConverter.CreateInstance%2A> must be called to make a change to one or more properties; otherwise .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default implementation always returns `true`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default implementation of this method does not use the `context` or `value` parameters, but simply refers the call to the TypeDescriptor.[TypeDescriptor.GetProperties(Type,â€‚Attribute\[\])](assetId:///M:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetProperties(System.Type,System.Attribute[])?qualifyHint=True&autoUpgrade=False) method.
